page.title: 12Blakesley Soapbox Grand Prix
page.content: The Blakesley Grand Prix was on the 18th September at 1.30p.m. infront of about 3000 people. A soapbox is a four wheeled vehicle without propulsion (except for a ramp or hill) but with brakes and steering. 38 soapboxes took part in 4 classes. The course was 600 metres long and dropped 20 metres. A 6 metre ramp at the start launched the soapboxes in pairs at up to 80 km.p.h. There were other attractions; a radio controlled model aircraft battle with bombs; an antiques fair and a display of old tractors which pulled them back to the start. The event raised over 4000 pounds for the Royal National Lifeboat Institution. The fastest time was set by "Newton's Wrong" in 52.79 seconds and the novelty club was won by "Tigger's Trucking Co." a beautiful model lorry.
